event.title: was included in the Louisiana Purchase of 1803

data.event: The territory known as Missouri was included in the Louisiana Purchase of 1803.

event.title: ’s Sequiota Park and the antique stores of its Galloway Village stand today

data.event: Soon after, the Delaware Native Americans received treaty land where Springfield’s Sequiota Park and the antique stores of its Galloway Village stand today.
Missouri became a state on August 10, 1821, and in 1833 the legislature designated most of the southern portion a single county.
A Tennessee homesteader, Campbell announced his claim in 1829.
Springfield was officially founded in 1830 and later incorporated in 1838.
Springfield was officially founded in 1830 and later incorporated in 1838.
